results.title: The Sausages
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Sebastian the Fox becomes involved with a tramp who is cooking sausages on a camp fire. The fox steals the sausages and is pursued by the tramp and finally caught. Not to be outdone, Sebastian sneaks more sausages while the tramp is not looking and runs happily away into the bush.

results.title: The Satiric eye
results.creator_credit: DEFA Studio, Hungarofilm and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents several animated pieces which satirize man in society. Illustrative sequences include a corpse which laughs at everyone’s grief; red tape which cannot be cut at the dedication of a bridge; and a lion that eats his tamer during a performance at a circus.

results.title:
The Sapphires
Julie (Jessica Mauboy) costume
results.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This form-fitting blue sequin dress worn be Julie (Jessica Mauboy) in The Sapphires (2012) is front and centre in the true story of an Indigenous singing group who entertained troops during the Vietnam War.

results.title: The Sapphires
results.creator_credit: Wayne Blair, Tony Briggs, Keith Thompson, Rosemary Blight, Melinda Doring, Gordon Westman, Goalpost Pictures and Kylie du Fresne
results.brief_description: It’s 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when they entertain the US troops in Vietnam as singing group The Sapphires.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

constellations_other.name: Sequins and sapphires
constellations_other.description: Two of the most striking costumes on the big and small screens embody the glamour of leading First Peoples ladies.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Blair, Tony Briggs, Keith Thompson, Rosemary Blight, Melinda Doring, Gordon Westman, Goalpost Pictures and Kylie du Fresne

results.title: The Santhia story
results.brief_description: The “Santhia” after a disastrous fire sank in the Hooghly River, India, where she lay untouched in the mud for two years. She was only nineteen feet from the wharf and was a menace to shipping. Captain J. P. Williams of the United Salvage Pty Ltd was given the task of raising her. The film shows the whole of the salvage operations and illustrates the various stages by diagrams. The divers go down into the thick mud of the fast-moving river to reconnoitre. They place pressure jets for bringing up the mud, place electrically fired explosive charges for removing the superstructures. Finally, the hull is raised by huge cranes and cleaned and towed away to be broken up by ship-wreckers. The whole salvage operation took nine months. From the series “Epics of salvage”.

results.title: The Sands of Yellow Rock
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Surveys the decay and decline of the Wollambi Valley area, N.S.W., and shows the investigations carried out by the Hunter Valley Research Foundation. Indicates methods used to check erosion and flooding.

results.title: The Sandlot kids
results.creator_credit: David Mickey Evans, William S. Gilmore, Dale de la Torre, Island World and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Sandlot kids is a heartwarming film about friendship. Scotty Smalls is new in town and the Sandlot Kids welcome him to their gang even though he can’t play baseball. Their summer adventures playing at the sandlot and confronting the dreaded beast living behind the left field fence changes Scotty’s life forever.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Mickey Evans, William S. Gilmore, Dale de la Torre, Island World and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: The Sand pebbles
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Argyle-Wise, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Solar Productions and Robert Wise Productions
results.brief_description: Set in revolutionary China in the 1920s (1926 to be precise), “The Sand pebbles” garnered Steve McQueen his only Oscar nomination (he lost to Paul Scofield in “A Man for all seasons”). McQueen plays navy engineer Jake Holman, sent to work on the gunboat San Pablo that trawls the tributaries of the Yangtze River, maintaining peace in a time of civil unrest whilst attempting to adopt a position of neutrality. The inhabitants of the boat are affectionately known as Sand Pebbles, of which Holman is reluctantly accepted, preferring to spend time with the machinery and slowly familiarising himself with the coolies (local inhabitants who work on the ship). Trouble brews when friend and crewman Frenchy (Richard Attenborough) falls in love with a local and makes her his bride. A tragedy ensues, Holman is made a scapegoat, and the San Pablo crew is faced into a series of incursions with local rebels. The film reaches a climax with Holman and Captain Collins (Richard Crenna) going back to China Light to save the lives of missionaries - one of whom (Candice Bergen) Holman has fallen in love with. Produced in 1966 and littered with what we would now perceive as cringeworthy racist remarks, the film drew clear parallels with the situation in Vietnam at the time and was the first film Wise made after the success of “The Sound of music”. Based on the novel by Richard McKenna. Screenplay by Robert Anderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Wise, Argyle-Wise, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Solar Productions and Robert Wise Productions

results.title: The Sand castle = Le Chateau de sable
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Gaston Sarault, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fable of great humor and appeal, The Sand Castle is the story of the Sandman and the creatures he sculpts out of sand. Under his direction, they build a castle and celebrate the completion of their new home, only to be interrupted by an uninvited guest. The wind blows, and the castle crumbles. The filmmaker leaves the door open to various interpretations. Sound film without words.
